title: 113_hr2776
content: The Act may be cited as the "Review EPA's Language on Agriculture and Thoroughly Engage with the Farm Act of 2013" or the "RELATE with the Farm Act of 2013". Regulatory review by the Secretary of Agriculture will be conducted. The Secretary of Agriculture will review publications from the Environmental Protection Agency that may impact agricultural entities, including regulatory agendas, plans, and other issued publications. The Secretary of Agriculture will review EPA publications containing plans or regulations that may impact agricultural entities. The Secretary will gather information and produce an economic impact statement for items deemed significant. The Secretary of Agriculture will convene a review panel to analyze a publication item containing cost estimates for agricultural entities. The panel will include representatives from the Department of Agriculture, the Environmental Protection Agency, and the Office of Information and Regulatory Affairs. The panel's duties include providing advice and recommendations on the potential impacts of the publication item. The Secretary of Agriculture will convene a review panel to analyze information related to a publication item. The panel will review materials, collect advice from agricultural entity representatives, analyze recommendations, and make suggestions to the Secretary. Comments on the review panel must be submitted within 60 days of its convening. The Secretary will submit comments on planned guidance to the Administrator, including a report on agricultural concerns, review panel findings, Secretary's findings, and recommendations. Comments will be published in the Federal Register and on the Department of Agriculture's website for public access. The Secretary may waive review panel initiation as deemed appropriate. "Agricultural entity" refers to entities involved in agricultural enterprises.
